sub_title: Inbound Planning & Trade Execution Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
Manager of the Inbound Planning and Trade Execution department (12 direct reports).

Responsibilities include:
• Inbound planning crude tropical vegetable oil flows to Rotterdam, Hamburg and Izegem refineries per sea vessels and barges (4 Inbound Planners). Organize and optimize inbound logistics and coordinate the process with all parties involved (agents, sellers, surveyors, barging companies, customs, Operations, Trading, Master Planning, storage companies).
• P&L responsible for Inbound department costs (>€18M yearly spent), including freight, demurrage, external storage, surveying activities. Ensure proper administration and reporting of costs.
• Trade Execution activities of Schiphol Tropical Oil Trading team (8 direct reports).  Monitoring and processing the tropical crude oil sales and purchases in close alignment with the Trading team. Proper allocation of contracts and Trades and optimizing on import duties where possible. Checking shipping documents against contractual terms and conditions for physical flows. Executing the (invoice) process to capture value of trades made and coordinating with all parties involved (> $1 billion USD yearly). 

• SAP TCC implementation for Tropical Oil Trading and Trade Execution (June '21)

profile_positions.description:
Ad interim manager for the Supply Planning team at Schiphol (10 direct reports) next to Inbound Planning & Trade Execution team role responsibility. 

Main responsibilities:
• Managing the team of Supply Planners responsible for Outbound planning of the Cargill Europe vegetable oil refineries in Amsterdam, St Nazaire, Antwerp, Salzgitter, Botlek and Third Party locations. Executing and coordinating short-term supply chain planning operations (Outbound). Coordinating between Production planning, customer service and Sofia Transport Execution team.

• SAP TC2 implementation for the Cargill base-oil refineries in Amsterdam, Antwerp, Salzgitter, and St Nazaire (April '22).
profile_positions.title: Supply Planning Team Lead (ad interim)

profile_positions.description:
Senior Master planner for Tropical Vegetable Oil refineries: Rotterdam (5 years), Hamburg (1 year), Izegem (6 months). Overall coordinator Tropical oil refineries (1 year).

Main Responsibilities
Supply and Capacity Planning for the short (0-3 months) and medium / long (3-24 months) term of all sellable goods. Coordinate and monitor demand planning, capacity planning (plant capacities and downtime coordination), crude oil supply planning, and sourcing plan. Through helicopter view of the plant(s) and refinery network optimize asset usage and supply chain.

• Coordinate and monitor Capacity Planning (plant capacities, downtime coordination and inventory management). Determine Supply Network plan within total refinery complex including financial impact.
• Keep Rough-Cut Capacity Plan refineries up-to-date and translate into actions on sourcing, network or plant optimization. Ensure demand and supply within any time-period is balanced across the available and capable assets.
• Make detailed downtime plans for refinery assets: stock building, internal backup, network usage, external purchases.
• Communicate available to-sell of intermediate and end products to Strategic Pricing and Product Line Managers.
• Coordinate day-to-day supply chain activities of other Supply Chain departments where needed and act as decision maker if needed in this process.
• Coach, mentor, train and help plant-schedulers in execution of their day-to-day work.
• Being a sound board for, and input provider to Strategic Pricing, Product Line Managers, Trading, Inbound Logistics, Outbound logistics, Customer service, Sales, Operations and Finance.
• Project member implementation S&OP / IBP process in Cargill GEOS Europe (2015).
• Pro-actively provide relevant ‘Tropical Oil network’ topics for Monthly IBP Supply Review meeting.
• Involved in multiple large asset (replacement) projects for the Rotterdam refinery as Supply Chain Subject Matter Expert (range €1M - €25M investments).

Education
